title: Go পরিচিতি

contents:
Strings str := "Hello" Multiline string
str := `Multiline string` Numbers Typical types
num := 3 // int num := 3. // float64 num := 3 + 4i // complex128 num := byte('a') // byte (alias for uint8) Other Types
var u uint = 7 // uint (unsigned) var p float32 = 22.7 // 32-bit float Arrays // var numbers [5]int numbers := [...]int{0, 0, 0, 0, 0} Pointers func main () { b := *getPointer() fmt.Println("Value is", b) func getPointer () (myPointer *int) { a := 234 return &a a := new(int) *a = 234 Pointers point to a memory location of a variable. Go is fully garbage-collected.
Type Conversion i := 2 f := float64(i) u := uint(i) Slice slice := []int{2, 3, 4} slice := []byte("Hello")

var u uint = 7 // uint (unsigned) var p float32 = 22.7 // 32-bit float Arrays // var numbers [5]int numbers := [...]int{0, 0, 0, 0, 0} Pointers func main () { b := *getPointer() fmt.
title: বেসিক টাইপ সমূহ

contents: Condition if day == "sunday" || day == "saturday" { rest() } else if day == "monday" && isTired() { groan() } else { work() } if _, err := doThing(); err != nil { fmt.Println("Uh oh") Switch switch day { case "sunday": // cases don't "fall through" by default! fallthrough case "saturday": rest() default: work() } Loop for count := 0; count <= 10; count++ { fmt.Println("My counter is at", count) } entry := []string{"Jack","John","Jones"} for i, val := range entry { fmt.Printf("At position %d, the character %s is present\n", i, val) n := 0 x := 42 for n != x { n := guess() }

title: ফাইল ম্যানিপুলেশন

contents: Variable NAME="John" echo $NAME echo "$NAME" echo "${NAME} Condition if [[ -z "$string" ]]; then echo "String is empty" elif [[ -n "$string" ]]; then echo "String is not empty" fi
summary: Variable NAME="John" echo $NAME echo "$NAME" echo "${NAME} Condition if [[ -z "$string" ]]; then echo "String is empty" elif [[ -n "$string" ]]; then echo "String is not empty" fi
title: ব্যাশ ভেরিয়েবল

contents:
Este archivo existe únicamente para responder a la URL /search con la plantilla de diseño search relacionada.
No se muestra ningún contenido aquí, todo el contenido se basa en la plantilla layouts/page/search.html
Establecer una prioridad muy baja en el mapa del sitio le dirá a los motores de búsqueda que éste no es un contenido importante.
Esta implementación utiliza Fusejs, jquery y mark.js
Configuración inicial La búsqueda depende del tipo de contenido de salida adicional de JSON en config.toml
``` [outputs] home = [“HTML”, “JSON”] ```
Búsqueda de archivos adicionales Para buscar campos adicionales definidos en el front matter, debes añadirlo en 2 lugares.
Editar layouts/_default/index.JSON Esto expone los valores en /index.json: por ejemplo, para agregar categories ``` … “contents”:{{ .Content | plainify | jsonify }} {{ if .Params.tags }}, “tags”:{{ .Params.tags | jsonify }}{{end}}, “categories” : {{ .Params.categories | jsonify }}, … ```
Editar las opciones de fuse.js para buscar static/js/search.js ``` keys: [ “title”, “contents”, “tags”, “categories” ] ```
summary:

Establecer una prioridad muy baja en el mapa del sitio le dirá a los motores de búsqueda que éste no es un contenido importante.
Esta implementación utiliza Fusejs, jquery y mark.js
Configuración inicial La búsqueda depende del tipo de contenido de salida adicional de JSON en config.
title: Resultados de Búsqueda

contents:
This file exists solely to respond to /search URL with the related search layout template.
No content shown here is rendered, all content is based in the template layouts/page/search.html
Setting a very low sitemap priority will tell search engines this is not important content.
This implementation uses Fusejs, jquery and mark.js
Initial setup Search depends on additional output content type of JSON in config.toml ``` [outputs] home = [“HTML”, “JSON”] ```
Searching additional fileds To search additional fields defined in front matter, you must add it in 2 places.
Edit layouts/_default/index.JSON This exposes the values in /index.json i.e. add category ``` … “contents”:{{ .Content | plainify | jsonify }} {{ if .Params.tags }}, “tags”:{{ .Params.tags | jsonify }}{{end}}, “categories” : {{ .Params.categories | jsonify }}, … ```
Edit fuse.js options to Search static/js/search.js ``` keys: [ “title”, “contents”, “tags”, “categories” ] ```

No content shown here is rendered, all content is based in the template layouts/page/search.html
Setting a very low sitemap priority will tell search engines this is not important content.
This implementation uses Fusejs, jquery and mark.js
Initial setup Search depends on additional output content type of JSON in config.toml ``` [outputs] home = [“HTML”, “JSON”] ```
Searching additional fileds To search additional fields defined in front matter, you must add it in 2 places.
Edit layouts/_default/index.JSON This exposes the values in /index.json i.e. add category ``` … “contents”:{{ .Content | plainify | jsonify }} {{ if .Params.tags }}, “tags”:{{ .Params.tags | jsonify }}{{end}}, “categories” : {{ .Params.categories | jsonify }}, … ```
Edit fuse.js options to Search static/js/search.js ``` keys: [ “title”, “contents”, “tags”, “categories” ] ```

contents: Claim: Buy this stereo system Reason: because it has a powerful amplifier. Grounds: comparison showing that the system’s amplifier outperforms others. customer feedback reporting the satisfaction with the system’s amplifier. Specification indicating that the system’s amplifier is powerful. Warrant: Powerful amplifiers make good stereo systems. Backing: evidence showing that powerful amplifiers can deliver more hi-fi music, deliver sound farther, work more efficiently, and enable more equalizer adjustments. Rebutting the reason: unless this system does not have a powerful amplifier. unless this system has other significant defects. Rebutting the warrant: unless a powerful amplifier does not work as efficient as imagined. unless a powerful amplifier is not the only one sufficient condition for a good stereo system. Qualifier: This stereo system might be a good choice because it has a powerful amplifier.
summary: Claim: Buy this stereo system Reason: because it has a powerful amplifier. Grounds: comparison showing that the system’s amplifier outperforms others. customer feedback reporting the satisfaction with the system’s amplifier. Specification indicating that the system’s amplifier is powerful. Warrant: Powerful amplifiers make good stereo systems. Backing: evidence showing that powerful amplifiers can deliver more hi-fi music, deliver sound farther, work more efficiently, and enable more equalizer adjustments. Rebutting the reason: unless this system does not have a powerful amplifier.
title: Basic Schema: Exercise-01

contents: Claim: Practicing the piano is good for kids Reason: because it teaches discipline. Grounds: Examples showing that playing the piano enhance a kid’s discipline. Cases or observation indicating that kids who plays piano behave decently and follow regulations. Statistics revealing that kids who playing better piano behave more disciplined. Warrant: Kids should be taught discipline. An activity that teaches discipline is good. Backing: Arguments showing that disciplined kids have better personal development, have more significant achievement, and establish better rapport with others. Examples of delinquent behavior or irresponsibility of undisciplined kids. Rebutting the reason: unless some who plays the piano but breaks the law. unless those who play piano do not behave more disciplined (e.g., less moody, indecent, or careless). unless kids can learn discipline through other approaches. Rebutting the warrant: unless kids should be raised naturally. unless the discipline refrains kids from being themselves and thus become psychologically unhealthy. unless an individual should learn discipline after adolescent. Qualifier: Practicing the piano may enhance a kid’s discipline. Practicing the piano could be good for kids because they can learn discipline from it.
summary: Claim: Practicing the piano is good for kids Reason: because it teaches discipline. Grounds: Examples showing that playing the piano enhance a kid’s discipline. Cases or observation indicating that kids who plays piano behave decently and follow regulations. Statistics revealing that kids who playing better piano behave more disciplined. Warrant: Kids should be taught discipline. An activity that teaches discipline is good. Backing: Arguments showing that disciplined kids have better personal development, have more significant achievement, and establish better rapport with others.
title: Basic Schema: Exercise-02

contents: Claim: Welfare benefits for unwed mothers should not be eliminated Reason: because these benefits are needed to prevent unbearable poverty among our nation’s most helpless citizens. Grounds: statistics reporting that unwed mothers are helpless citizens and suffer poverty. examples showing that welfare benefits prevent unwed mothers from being poor. interviews with unwed mothers indicating that these welfare benefits are necessary and helpful. Warrant: We should prevent poverty among our nation’s most helpless citizens. Backing: Arguments showing that it is humane to support those in need. Arguments suggesting that eliminating poverty fosters a nation’s development. Arguments warning that ignoring the need of most helpless citizens may result in a rise in crime. Rebutting the reason: unless these benefits are not enough to ameliorate poverty. unless these benefits are not effectively given to the most helpless citizens (i.e., a corrupt bureaucracy). unless poverty should be ameliorated by other approaches (e.g., increase job opportunities and provide employment counselling as well as career guidance). Rebutting the warrant: unless our nation is suffering a significant economic crisis and thus currently cannot afford to taking care of the most helpless citizens. unless the nation’s religion supports Chauvinism or a Caste system. unless the most critical challenges of the helpless residents is not poverty (e.g., human rights). Qualifier: Welfare benefits for unwed mothers should not be eliminated because it may help those helpless.
summary: Claim: Welfare benefits for unwed mothers should not be eliminated Reason: because these benefits are needed to prevent unbearable poverty among our nation’s most helpless citizens. Grounds: statistics reporting that unwed mothers are helpless citizens and suffer poverty. examples showing that welfare benefits prevent unwed mothers from being poor. interviews with unwed mothers indicating that these welfare benefits are necessary and helpful. Warrant: We should prevent poverty among our nation’s most helpless citizens.
title: Basic Schema: Exercise-03

contents: Claim: The Endangered Species Act is too stringent Reason: because it severely damages the economy. Grounds: Data showing that the damaged economy is caused by this Act, and the constraints listed in the Act greatly decrease economic benefits. Testimony showing that loosening the act will substantially improve the economy. Testimony from economic experts (e.g., officials, scholars, and commentators) may be authoritative and convincing. We should take their advice if they claim that the economy will improve with a looser act after considering overall situations. Warrant: Something that damages the economy is bad. Backing: Evidence supporting that the economy is crucial for a country. Arguments showing the risk and downside of a damaged economy. Rebutting the reason: unless this legislation is reasonable and easy to follow. unless the plummet in economy results from other factors. unless the act boosts the economy in the long run. Rebutting the warrant: unless economy is not always the priority (e.g. international law and human rights). unless a nation’s economy is oligarchy and thus against the benefits of the majority. Qualifier: The Endangered Species Act may hurt the economy. The Endangered Species Act might be too stringent.
summary: Claim: The Endangered Species Act is too stringent Reason: because it severely damages the economy. Grounds: Data showing that the damaged economy is caused by this Act, and the constraints listed in the Act greatly decrease economic benefits. Testimony showing that loosening the act will substantially improve the economy. Testimony from economic experts (e.g., officials, scholars, and commentators) may be authoritative and convincing. We should take their advice if they claim that the economy will improve with a looser act after considering overall situations.
title: Basic Schema: Exercise-04

contents: Claim: Abortion should be legal. Reason: because a woman has the right to control her own body. Grounds: Testimony supporting that abortion represents control of the body. Arguments indicating that abortion is a women’s right Laws that guarantee individual freedom. A list of countries that have already legalized abortion. Warrant: We have the right to control our own bodies. A fetus belongs to a pregnant woman. (surrogate mother?) A pregnant woman has the right to decide the fate of the fetus. Backing: Laws in the Constitution supporting the right of body control. Arguments stating that a fetus is a part of a pregnant woman’s body and the woman owns it. Arguments showing that a pregnant woman should have the right to determine the fetus’s fate. Rebutting the reason and grounds: unless abortion results in other concerns more significant than the right of body control (e.g., a fetus’ life). unless legalizing abortion will result in more unplanned pregnancy. unless abortion does significant harm to women’s body and thus should be prohibited. unless abortion will proliferate. unless abortion does not represent body control. Rebutting the warrant: unless a pregnant woman has no right to sentence the death of the fetus. Qualifier: Legalizing abortion should be considered.
summary: Claim: Abortion should be legal. Reason: because a woman has the right to control her own body. Grounds: Testimony supporting that abortion represents control of the body. Arguments indicating that abortion is a women’s right Laws that guarantee individual freedom. A list of countries that have already legalized abortion. Warrant: We have the right to control our own bodies. A fetus belongs to a pregnant woman. (surrogate mother?) A pregnant woman has the right to decide the fate of the fetus.
title: Basic Schema: Exercise-05

contents:
The Toulmin’s system comes from pholosopher Stephen Toulmin.
This system assumes:
that all assertions and assumptions are contestable. that all final verdicts about the persuasiveness of the opposing arguments should be supported by a neutral third party
summary:
The Toulmin’s system comes from pholosopher Stephen Toulmin.
This system assumes:
that all assertions and assumptions are contestable. that all final verdicts about the persuasiveness of the opposing arguments should be supported by a neutral third party
title: Introduction of the Toulmin System
